Auto Generated Documentation¶

generate_plan.build_plan(user)[source]¶

Steps: 1. Decide how many days to run on each week up until race day 2. Decide how many miles to run on each week 3. Select appropriate proportion of run vector 4. Return plan, divided by week

generate_plan.combine_miles_days(miles_per_week, days_per_week, preferences, run_vector)[source]¶
generate_plan.generate_days_per_week(preferences, weeks)[source]¶

Given the preferences dictionary and the number of weeks in the plan, this function returns a list of the number of training days per week for each week of the training plan.

INPUTS max_days: number of days per week the user wants to run level: intermediate or novice increase: boolean to indicate whether the user (intermediate only) wants to increase training. Will be True if level = novice weeks: number of weeks left until race day previous_days: number of training days per week from previous training. Will be -1 if no previous data

OUTPUTS plan: vector of number of days per week for remaining training

generate_plan.generate_mpw(mileage_baseline, mileage_limit, weeks)[source]¶

Given the preferences dictionary and number of weeks in the plan, this function returns a list of weekly mileages for the individual.

generate_plan.generate_plan(user)[source]¶
